flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: The Hardy–Weinberg principle states that if a population meets certain criteria (aimed at a lack of evolution), then the allele frequencies will remain constant (Hardy–Weinberg equilibrium).
flashcards.mnemonic: Acronym: AF - allele frequencies. Associate each letter with the word.

flashcards.subject: Biology
flashcards.definition: Species are reproductively isolated from each other by pre- or postzygotic mechanisms.
flashcards.mnemonic: Word roots: 'iso' = equal; 'pro' = before/for. Remember what these roots mean!
